section.title: Luthetus.TextEditor.RazorLib.CompilerServices.Utility.StringWalker Class Reference

para.para: Provides common API that can be used when implementing an ITextEditorLexer for the TextEditorModel.The marker for an out of bounds read is ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE.

listitem.para: StringWalker (ResourceUri resourceUri, string sourceText)
Pass in the ResourceUri of a file, and its text. One can pass in string.Empty for the ResourceUri if they are only working with the text itself.
char ReadCharacter ()

If PositionIndex is within bounds of the SourceText.Then the character within the string SourceText at index of PositionIndex is returned and PositionIndex is incremented by one.Otherwise, ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE is returned and the value of PositionIndex is unchanged.
char PeekCharacter (int offset)

If (PositionIndex + offset) is within bounds of the SourceText.Then the character within the string SourceText at index of (PositionIndex + offset) is returned and PositionIndex is unchanged.Otherwise, ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE is returned and the value of PositionIndex is unchanged.offset must be > -1.
char BacktrackCharacter ()

If PositionIndex being decremented by 1 would result in PositionIndex being less than 0.Then ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE will be returned and PositionIndex will be left unchanged.Otherwise, PositionIndex will be decremented by one and the character within the string SourceText at index of PositionIndex is returned.
string ReadRange (int length)

Iterates a counter from 0 until the counter is equal to length.Each iteration ReadCharacter will be invoked.If an iteration's invocation of ReadCharacter returned ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE then the method will short circuit and return regardless of whether it finished iterating to length or not.
string PeekRange (int offset, int length)

Iterates a counter from 0 until the counter is equal to length.Each iteration PeekCharacter will be invoked using the (offset + counter).If an iteration's invocation of PeekCharacter returned ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE then the method will short circuit and return regardless of whether it finished iterating to length or not.
string BacktrackRange (int length)

Iterates a counter from 0 until the counter is equal to length.Each iteration BacktrackCharacter will be invoked using the.If an iteration's invocation of BacktrackCharacter returned ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE then the method will short circuit and return regardless of whether it finished iterating to length or not.
string PeekNextWord ()
bool PeekForSubstring (string substring)

Form a substring of the SourceText that starts inclusively at the index PositionIndex and has a maximum length of substring.Length.This method uses PeekRange internally and therefore will return a string that ends with ParserFacts.END_OF_FILE if an index out of bounds read was performed on SourceText.
bool PeekForSubstringRange (ImmutableArray< string > substringsList, out string? matchedOn)
string ReadWhitespace (IEnumerable< char >? whitespaceOverrideList=null)
Provide whitespaceOverrideList to override the default of what qualifies as whitespace. The default whitespace chars are: WhitespaceFacts.ALL_LIST.
NumericLiteralToken ReadUnsignedNumericLiteral ()
string ReadUntil (char deliminator)
string ReadLine ()
The line ending is NOT included in the returned string.
TextEditorTextSpan string value ReadWordTuple (ImmutableArray< char >? additionalCharactersToBreakOnList=null)
This method will return immediately upon encountering whitespace. Returns a text span with its TextEditorTextSpan.StartingIndexInclusive equal to '-1' if no word was found.
int PositionIndex [get]
The character index within the SourceText.
ResourceUri ResourceUri [get]
The file that the SourceText came from.
string SourceText [get]
The text which is to be stepped through.
char CurrentCharacter [get]
Returns PeekCharacter invoked with the value of zero.
char NextCharacter [get]
Returns PeekCharacter invoked with the value of one.
string RemainingText [get]
Starting with PeekCharacter evaluated at 0 return that and the rest of the SourceTextRemainingText => SourceText.Substring(PositionIndex);.
bool IsEof [get]
Returns if the current character is the end of file character.
